title: GUIDANCE FOR CLINICAL TRIAL PROTOCOLS
cleaned_text: SPIRIT (Standard Protocol Items: Recommendations for Interventional Trials) The [SPIRIT 2013 Statement ](https://www.spirit-statement.org/publications-downloads/)provides evidence-based recommendations for the minimum content of a clinical trial protocol. SPIRIT is [widely endorsed](https://www.spirit-statement.org/about-spirit/spirit-endorsement/) as an international standard for trial protocols. The recommendations are outlined in a [33-item checklist](https://www.spirit-statement.org/title/) and [figure](https://www.spirit-statement.org/schedule-of-enrolment-interventions-and-assessments/). Each checklist item is detailed in the [Explanation & Elaboration](https://www.spirit-statement.org/publications-downloads/) paper. Key Documents SEPTRE (SPIRIT Electronic Protocol Tool & Resource) is an innovative web-based tool that simplifies the creation, formatting, and registration of high-quality trial protocols. The SEPTRE protocol tool incorporates automation and the evidence-based SPIRIT guidance to strengthen the quality, efficiency, and transparency of clinical trials. Please [contact us](../../../../../../../septre-free-trial-request/) for a demo and further details.
